moves.1. f4: 1...From Gambit, e5...leads to sharp play, as played this is a Dutch but W has a move in hand.
9.   Holy Swiss cheese, Batman...holes at d3,c4, e4. and g3...
moves.9... O-O 10. d3 Qc8 11. Nbd2 Bxh3 12. gx: 13...Doubtful that B has compensation for the piece...W can get his Q over to g2, and force a trade or retreat with a loss of tempo...B doesn't have a really good follow up to the piece sacrifice
16. W should win this now....he has no weak spots, and the extra piece should tell
moves.16... Rad8 17. Nc5: 17.  A strong outpost for this knight...opening up this game will just make W's pieces more active...so black has got a real problem here
moves.17... Nb8 18. Rh1 Nf6 19. Bd2 Nfd7 20. d: 27. R takes g6 right away, and B is just about cooked
moves.27. Nh4 Ne7 28. Nxg6 Nxg6 29. Rxg6 Rf6: 30. Rg2 with the threat of a capture on f6, using the pin forces more simplification.
moves.30. Rg2 Kf7 31. Rhg1 Rg8 32. Be1: 32. B's rook is f6 is horribly misplaced...I would have looked at c4...worth a pawn to open the long diagonal for the Black squared B...the doubled pawn on c4 couldn't be held anyway
moves.32... c6 33. Kf1 Kf8 34. Bd1: 34.  This is also good...h5 and g6, f7 are weak...B is missing that light squared B
moves.34... Rf7 35. Bh5 Rd7 36. Bh4: 36.  Also good, activate all pieces and apply pressure till the position cracks
moves.36... a5 37. Bf6 Ra7 38. Be5 a4 39. Bd6+: 39. Ouch!...B wins an exchange, and then the B on g7
